text.p: -- Hambrecht & Quist analyst Jim Pickrel said he is cutting his earnings estimates for Sybase Inc "to reflect a more conservative outlook" on the company going forward.

-- Pickrel cut his fourth quarter 1996 estimate from a share profit of $0.11 to $0.05, sending the full year to a loss of $0.35 a share from a loss of $0.31. He cut his 1997 earnings estimate to $0.33 a share from $0.54.
-- Thursday, Sybase reported an operating profit of $0.01 a share, beating the Street estimate of a $0.06 share loss.

-- In a statement, Pickrel called the third quarter results "encouraging" and said the "return to profitability marks (the) first stage of a possible turnaround - customer loyalty and successful product rollouts will determine (the) outcome."
